verses.roman:
ekadā te paśūn pālāś'
cārayanto 'dri-sānuṣu
cakrur nilāyana-krīḍāś
cora-pālāpadeśataḥ

synonyms: ekadā—one day; te—they; paśūn—the animals; pālāḥ—the cowherd boys; cārayantaḥ—grazing; adri—of a mountain; sānuṣu—on the sides; cakruḥ—they enacted; nilāyana—of "stealing and hiding"; krīḍāḥ—games; cora—of thieves; pāla—and protectors; apadeśataḥ—playing the roles.
translation: One day the cowherd boys, while grazing their animals on the mountain slopes, played the game of stealing and hiding, acting out the roles of rival thieves and herders.
